job.name: Feature_Vector_Extractor

variable.description: Name of the Native Scheduler node source to use when the workflow tasks must be deployed inside a cluster such as SLURM, LSF, etc.
variable.name: NATIVE_SCHEDULER

variable.description: Parameters given to the native scheduler (SLURM, LSF, etc) while requesting a ProActive node used to deploy the workflow tasks.
variable.name: NATIVE_SCHEDULER_PARAMS

variable.description: If not empty, the workflow tasks will be run only on nodes belonging to the specified node source.
variable.name: NODE_SOURCE_NAME

variable.description: If not empty, the workflow tasks will be run only on nodes that contains the specified token.
variable.name: NODE_ACCESS_TOKEN

variable.description: The working directory for the data space used to transfer files automatically between the workflow tasks.
variable.name: WORK_DIR

variable.description: Container platform used for executing the workflow tasks.
variable.name: CONTAINER_PLATFORM

variable.description: If True, it will activate the use of GPU for the workflow tasks on the selected container platform.
variable.name: CONTAINER_GPU_ENABLED

variable.description: Name of the container image being used to run the workflow tasks.
variable.name: CONTAINER_IMAGE

job.description: Encode structured data into numerical feature vectors.

task.name: Feature_Vector_Extractor
task.description: Encode structured data into numerical feature vectors whereby machine learning models can be applied.

variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored, it will not be executed.
variable.name: TASK_ENABLED

variable.description: The ID of the entity that you need to represent (to group by).
variable.name: SESSION_COLUMN

variable.description: The index of column containing the log patterns.[specific to features extraction from logs].
variable.name: PATTERN_COLUMN

variable.description: True if you need to extract count the number of occurrence of each pattern per session.
variable.name: PATTERNS_COUNT_FEATURES

variable.description: The different variables that need to be considered to extract features according to their content.
variable.name: STATE_VARIABLES

variable.description: Refers to the different variables that need to be considered to count their distinct content.
variable.name: COUNT_VARIABLES

variable.description: True if you need to extract state and count features per session.
variable.name: STATE_COUNT_FEATURES_VARIABLES

variable.description: The number of rows that will be previewed in the browser.
variable.name: LIMIT_OUTPUT_VIEW

metadata.visualization: Feature_Vector_Extractor
